Package com.optiply.infrastructure.data.repositories.interfaces

Interface IWebshopRepository

All Known Implementing Classes:
WebshopRepository
public interface IWebshopRepository
The interface for the webshop table repository. This interface is used to interact with the webshop table.

  • Method Details

    • create

      reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Boolean> create(String handle, String url, Double A, Double B, Double C, Short interestRate, String currency, Boolean runJobs, Boolean multiSupplier)
      Create a new webshop (complex). Meaning, it will create a new webshop with all the fields.
      Parameters:
      handle - the handle
      url - the url
      A - the service level A percentage
      B - the service level B percentage
      C - the service level C percentage
      interestRate - the interest rate
      currency - the currency in ISO 4217 format
      runJobs - if the webshop will run jobs
      multiSupplier - if it has multiple suppliers
      Returns:
      the mono

    • findVarious

      reactor.core.publisher.Flux<String> findVarious(org.jooq.Condition condition, org.jooq.SortField<?> sort)
      Find various webshops, filtered by various conditions and sorted by a field with a certain order. This method is used to find webshops that match the conditions.
      Parameters:
      condition - the condition(s) to filter the webshops
      sort - the sortfield which sorts the webshops
      Returns:
      Flux with the webshops found

    • find

      reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Webshop> find(String handle)
      Find a webshop by its handle.
      Parameters:
      handle - the handle
      Returns:
      Mono with the webshop

    • updateWebshop

      reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Boolean> updateWebshop(String handle, String newHandle, String url, Double serviceLevelA, Double serviceLevelB, Double serviceLevelC, Short interestRate, String currency, Boolean runJobs, Boolean multiSupplier)
      Updates a webshop given all the fields.
      Parameters:
      handle - the handle
      newHandle - the new handle
      url - the url
      serviceLevelA - the service level A percentage
      serviceLevelB - the service level B percentage
      serviceLevelC - the service level C percentage
      interestRate - the interest rate
      currency - the currency in ISO 4217 format
      runJobs - the ability to run jobs
      multiSupplier - if it has multiple suppliers
      Returns:
      Mono with boolean indicating success
